> Is it possible to contribute ign-gazebo systems from another repository? Then ign-sensors could be a collection of systems.

Yes, systems are just plugins, so they can come from other libraries, but the library will need to depend on `ign-gazebo`. In the case of sensors, we would like `ign-gazebo` to ship with several default sensors by default, so we would need to find a way to ship those together. But the main point of `ign-sensors` originally was for it to be a gazebo-independent library, and adding this dependency would invalidate that.

> Can we guaranteed that all sensors can be updated at the same time with the same data?

Yes, all systems are being updated at the same time with the same data. We currently don't have a way to configure the update rate of each system though, so they're all running at the maximum rate.

> We can then convert ign-sensors to a group of classes that are used in ign-gazebo’s systems.

Yes, I think this could be a way to integrate it. I'd be curious to see what kind of interfaces that class would expose to `ign-gazebo`, maybe it's worth it making a quick proof of concept implementation to compare with this PR.

> SDF processing should be done in ign-gazebo or in ign-sensors?

`ign-gazebo` will do it no matter what. It can forward it to `ign-sensors` if needed, like it currently does with `ign-physics`.

> the function of ignition sensors should be to modify and expose sensor data coming from the simulation simulating real life sensors

Yes, I agree with that pull request. We just need to figure out the best place to draw a line between what goes in `ign-sensors` and what goes here.

---

Not sure if you've seen [this discussion](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/114/wip-camera-sensors/diff#comment-87119446). Feel free to add comments there if you see fit.
